etymology.description: 自(自) (zì, "self") + 行(行) (xíng, "move") + 车(車) (chē, "vehicle") = a vehicle that moves by itself, referring to a bicycle
etymology.interpretation: 自行车(自行車) (zìxíngchē, "bicycle") refers to a vehicle that operates using the rider's own power, as in moving oneself along. The combination makes sense as it describes a mode of transportation propelled by the rider's own effort, reflecting the functionality of a bicycle.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢骑自行车(我喜歡騎自行車)。
他打算买自行车(他打算買自行車)，以便上下学(以便上下學)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dǎsuàn mǎi zìxíngchē, yǐbiàn shàngxiàxué.
examples.english: He plans to buy a bicycle in order to commute to school.

examples.chinese: 暑假结束时(暑假結束時)，她骑着自行车回学院(她騎著自行車回學院)。
examples.pinyin: Shǔjià jiéshù shí, tā qízhe zìxíngchē huí xuéyuàn.
examples.english: When the summer vacation ended, she rode her bicycle back to college.
